headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; CARMAN'S UNION ASSOCIATION. DISTURBING A MEETING CITY MORTALITY.

docs.lead_paragraph: CARMAN'S UNION ASSOCIATION.--This Association, composed of a larger portion of the Carman of our city, made their annual parade yesterday, under the charge of ex-Alderman JAMES McNEELY, as Marshal. The procession numbered about 150 stalwart men, all mounted and wearing their white sacks, making a very creditable appearance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. JOHN S. SHULER died suddenly, in San Francisco, of apoplexy. Doctor SHULER arrived in Colifornia over three years ago. Soon after, he opened a private hospital for the sick. Many lives of invalid immigrants were saved under his nursing care. He commenced practice in Eastern New-York. About twnetysix years ago, he removed to Lower Lockport, in this State, and was one of the early pioneers of the town.

headline.main: FROM CALIFORNIA.; TWO WEEKS' LATER INTELLIGENCE. ARRIVAL OF THE NORTHERN LIGHT.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Northern Light, Capt. CHURCHILL, from San Juan del Norte, with 382 passengers and $615,000 in gold, arrived at this port on Saturday morning. The Northern Light left New-York on Saturday afternoon, the 4th inst., and arrived at San Juan on the morning of the 14th, t 8 o'clock, having called at Kingston for coals.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; THE TRADES. The Operative Plasterers' Protective Union Association. Street Cleaning. German Anti-Maine Law Demonstration-- Torchlight Procession--Speeches, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: A meeting of this Society was held at Mr. HARRIOT's, corner of Sixth-avenue and Twenty-seventhstreet, on Thursday evening, for the purpose of enrolling new members, and to elect officers for the ensuing six months. The number enrolled, and paying the initiation fee, was about fifty persons. After the reading of the minutes, and the rules drawn up by the Committee, (to be submitted hereafter to the Society for approval or...

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE,; ARRIVAL OF THE PACIFIC. CAUSE OF HER DELAY--THE ICE FIELDS. THE EASTERN QUESTION. RUMORED FALL OF KALAFAT The Czar's Answer to Napoleon. docs.lead_paragraph: The steamer brings a shower of manifestoes. There are two from Russia, one from France, and one from Austria. The Czar haughtily intimates to Louis NAPOLEON that " Russia will show herself in 1854, what she was in 1812." his is a rather lame
